physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At the time of presentation, there was a polymorphic macular/papular excoriated dermatitis most notable on the upper and lower back, deltoids, hip, waist, and less on the extremities. No vesiculobullous lesions were present but had occurred previously.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial skin biopsy performed 4 months prior was read as a nonspecific dermatitis. After initial steroid treatment, the lesions cleared but recurred once the treatment was completed, indicating worsening once steroids were stopped.
